agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING DIRECT HOME LOANS - KNOX AREA OFFICE
service_description: Provides loans to rural homeowners with low to very-low-income to purchase, repair or improve their homes, or to remove health and safety hazards. Qualified repairs may include new roof, siding, or windows, new septic system or furnace/AC, or new kitchen cabinets. Interest rate is contingent on applicant's income.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Elkhart, Fulton, Howard, Jasper, Kosciusko, Lake, La Porte, Marshall, Miami, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, St Joseph, Starke, and White County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA

service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING DIRECT HOME LOANS - KNOX AREA OFFICE
service_description: Provides loans to rural homeowners with low to very-low-income to purchase, repair or improve their homes, or to remove health and safety hazards. site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Elkhart, Fulton, Howard, Jasper, Kosciusko, Lake, La Porte, Marshall, Miami, Newton, Porter, Pulaski, St Joseph, Starke, and White County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING HOME REPAIR LOANS - KNOX AREA OFFICE
service_description: Offers loans to eligible applicants to purchase homes in eligible rural areas.  Offers a loan to eligible rural homeowners for modifications needed to make their home accessible or remove health and safety hazards. Maximum loan amount is $20,000, with a 1% interest rate. There is a $10,000 lifetime limit on grant funds for eligible seniors, 62 and older,. Grant recipients must repay if home is sold during first three years.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Elkhart, Fulton, Howard, Jasper, Pulaski, St Joseph, Starke, and White County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food items to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule: Monthly 1st and 3rd Wed 4pm - while supplies last
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY - STARKE AND PULASKI
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY - STARKE AND PULASKI
service_description: Builds and sells homes for eligible low-income persons in Starke and Pulaski Counties. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to request an application; leave name and contact information on the voicemail.
site_eligibility: Living or working in Starke or Pulaski County for the past 2 years -- Household income between set guidelines (call or see website for current amounts) -- Able to make payments (steady employment history or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a children's clothing closet and community meal.
service_description: Provides a free hot lunch each month for all in need.
site_details: Walk in; proceed to Fellowship Hall
site_schedule: Meal: Monthly last Sat 11am-1pm -- Church Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 2pm-5pm
site_eligibility: Primarily serves the town of North Judson and surrounding areas

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a children's clothing closet and community meal.
site_name: NORTH JUDSON UNITED METHODIST CHURCH KID'S CLOSET
service_description: Provides gently used clothing to area children in need. Each eligible child may receive up to 10 sets of clothing annually. Available selection and sizes are dependent upon donations.
site_details: Call to complete an intake assessment; if voicemail is received, leave a message including contact information and age of child.
site_schedule: Kid's Closet: By appointment only -- Church Office: Mon, Wed, and Thurs 2pm-5pm
site_eligibility: Children infant through grade 12 -- Living in Starke County -- Limit two deliveries per year

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers animal care services and shelter for surrendered animals.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items include cat and dog food, blankets, towels, cleaning supplies, and newspaper.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit website for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri 11am-4pm; Sat 11am-1pm
site_eligibility: Open -- Volunteers: Age 15 or older

agency_name: STARKE COUNTY INITIATIVE FOR LIFELONG LEARNING
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides education and training services.
site_name: STARKE COUNTY INITIATIVE FOR LIFELONG LEARNING (SCILL)
service_description: Offers a 12-week, hands-on welding technology program for beginning learners. Subjects include blueprint reading, welding techniques, measurements, brazing, plasma cutting, and safety precautions. Graduates may be connected to employers, upon completion of the program.
site_details: Call for enrollment information or fill out an application online.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

service_description: Provide basic health care including immunizations, school, sports, employment, and CDL physicals, disease management, and laboratory testing to persons in Pulaski and Starke counties.
site_details: Call to make an appointment or for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization whose mission is improving its communities by expanding access to health care.
service_description: Offers outpatient behavioral health treatment to children, adolescents, and adults experiencing a variety of mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, mental illness, addiction, trauma, and grief.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- For locations and hours, visit www.healthlincchc.org/find-a-location.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides reference assistance in a variety of ways. Additional in-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Call or email for information. -- Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services.
site_eligibility: For a library card: Living in the town of North Judson or Wayne Township in Starke County -- Most in-house services, including public computers, do not require a library card.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to persons in need in Starke County.
service_description: Offers free, objective information on Medicare, Medicare supplements, Medicare Advantage plans, Medicaid, long-term care insurance, and prescription assistance programs. SHIP counselors are trained and certified by the Indiana Department of Insurance. This office serves Starke County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: People who are or will soon become eligible for Medicare

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to persons in need in Starke County.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to persons in need in Starke County. Clients are able to make their own selection. Offers a 3-day supply of food for each member of the household.
site_details: Call for an appointment.
site_eligibility: Not received food from this pantry within the past month -- Living in Starke County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to persons in need in Starke County.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults and persons with disabilities in Starke County. Activities include special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Starke County -- Aged 55 and older -OR- With a disability

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to persons in need in Starke County.
service_description: Helps qualified Starke County residents with limited emergency funds.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Each case is reviewed individually after an appointment and assessment of need -- Requires a referral from a township trustee or another agency

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to persons in need in Starke County.
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb transportation services for persons in Starke County.
site_details: Call for service. Clients are encouraged to make a reservation at least 24 hours in advance within Starke County, outside of Starke County at least 1 week in advance.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering community outreach and assistance programs to persons in need in Starke County.
service_description: Provides up to $400 in gas bill assistance for NIPSCO customers at risk of disconnection in Starke County. This program is limited to households whose income disqualifies them from federal energy assistance. No assistance is available for utility deposits, but funds may be used for reconnection fees. Any amount due over $400 must be paid before assistance is granted.
site_details: Call to begin the initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Living in Starke County -- Household income between 151%-200% Federal Poverty Level -- NIPSCO natural gas customers -- With a disconnect notice for a gas bill up to $400 (any past due amount over $400 must be paid by client prior to receiving assistance)

agency_desc: A community mental health center offering a range of mental health and addiction treatment services.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient treatment for adolescents and adults with substance abuse issues. Treatment may include counseling, group therapy, case management, and referrals to community resources. Intensive outpatient services available.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A community mental health center offering a range of mental health and addiction treatment services.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons in need. Programs include individual and family counseling, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.

site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Knox in Starke County.
service_description: Oversees court cases for the city of Knox, hearing both civil and criminal misdemeanor infractions as assigned by the Starke County prosecutor's office. Operates the traffic court, accepting traffic ticket payments in person, by mail, or online.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutors office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the court directly.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Phone Hours: Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon -- Court Sessions: Tues 9am; Wed and Thurs 3pm
site_eligibility: Persons ordered to appear in front of or pay a fine to this court

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Starke County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards, such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.

service_description: Provides probation services for the Starke County Circuit and the Knox City Courts, including supervising adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.

site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Starke County Circuit Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Walk in for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Starke County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Starke County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Starke County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Starke County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact Court Clerk.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Starke County Circuit and Superior Courts
